page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF ROTHWELL
page.content: There are about 200 people living in either tied cottages, council houses or a small number of privately owned dwellings. The village is surrounded by arable and sheep farming land disposed over the wold hillside rising from 2-300 fett. A beck runs west to east through the centre of the village where three main access roads intersect adjacent to the Nickerson Arms. A lane leads to the village hall and the 9th century church of St. Marys. Villagers are mainly employed on either of two farms or at one of the Cherry Valley enterprises. The village is also the administration and research centre for an international seed development group. There are only a few children among a mainly older population. There is a small village post office but there are no longer two methodist chapels, a village
